message_1: What is the enthalpy of vaporization of water if 45 grams of water absorbs 167.7 kJ of heat during vaporization at its boiling point of 100°C?
message_2:
To find the enthalpy of vaporization of water, we can use the formula:

Enthalpy of vaporization (ΔHvap) = Heat absorbed (q) / Mass of water (m)

First, we need to convert the heat absorbed from kJ to J:

167.7 kJ * 1000 J/kJ = 167700 J

Now, we can plug the values into the formula:

ΔHvap = 167700 J / 45 g

ΔHvap ≈ 3726.67 J/g

The enthalpy of vaporization of water is approximately 3726.67 J/g.
